Class StaticText

java.lang.Object
  greenfoot.Actor
      StaticText

public class StaticText
extends greenfoot.Actor

StaticText creates a static text object, such as a game over screen, on the world. The basic call of StaticText is StaticText st = new StaticText(getWorld(), "My text here"); . If you want to choose the fontsize, call it like StaticText st = new StaticText(getWorld(), "My text here", 16); to get font size 16. If you want to choose the color, call StaticText st = new StaticText(getWorld(), "My text here", 16, Color.RED); . To do this you must import java.awt.Color to the class that calls StaticText. You can also specifiy a foreground and background color using StaticText st = new StaticText(getWorld(), "My text here", 16, Color.RED, Color.BLACK); Finally you can specify x and y the location. This would look like: StaticText st = new StaticText(getWorld(), "My text here", 16, Color.RED, Color.BLACK, 300, 200);

Version:
1.0
Author:
Jim Stewart
